name: Shell China Carbon Credit Scandal
description: Investigation into Shell's purchase of fraudulent carbon credits from Chinese projects

key_facts.issue: Additionality failure - projects would have been built anyway

detection_signals: Projects received government subsidies making them profitable without credits
Grid-connected renewables in China already economically viable
No evidence of credit revenue in project financial plans
Compression analysis showed moderate fraud signal (0.68 ratio)
lessons_learned: Grid-connected renewables in subsidized markets often non-additional
Financial additionality must be independently verified
Wealthy country/grid projects require heightened scrutiny
